text: Acharagma aguirreanum is a critically endangered microendemic cactus. It has a range of about one square kilometer in the calcareous semi-desert of the Sierra de la Paila in Coahuila, Mexico. Its population is estimated at less than 1000 individuals. Its only major threat is illegal collecting. ==References== * Anderson, E.F., Fitz Maurice, W.A. & Fitz Maurice, B. 2002. Escobaria aguirreana. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 August 2007. * Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Cactoideae
title: Acharagma aguirreanum
